snippet: In the 20th century, Brooklyn breweries dominated the industry. Now, developers are paying tribute to the borough’s heritage, and new breweries are seeking to revive its stature.
abstract: The Appraisal column; North Brooklyn, once the brewing capital of New York State, is beginning to recover some of its beer-related heritage; developers of apartment complexes replacing Schaefer and Rheingold breweries plan to commemorate factories' past; new, smaller breweries have also begun to crop up in area.
lead_paragraph: In the 20th century, Brooklyn breweries dominated the industry. Now, developers are paying tribute to the borough’s heritage, and new breweries are seeking to revive its stature.

headline.print_headline: Honoring the Heritage of Brooklyn’s Breweries
headline.main: Builders and Brewers Honor Brooklyn’s Beer Heritage
